EMV Card Technology Specific Functions
EMV

This part contains RFID card operations which are in general available on every card technology but the implementation of which depends on the card technology (ISO14443-A or ISO14443-B) in use. More...

 Perform an ISO14443-B PICC removal.

Detailed Description

This module contains RFID operations which are typically available on ISO14443-A and ISO14443-B cards. But, due to differences between these two card technologies it is not possible to provide a single implementation for both technologies.

This operations include:

  • Presence detection: Used by the polling loop to detect the presence of cards from a specific technology (emvTypeACardPresent(), emvTypeBCardPresent()).
  • Singulation: Used after cars of one technology only have been found to ensure that only one card of that technology is present in the reader field (emvTypeAAnticollision(), emvTypeBAnticollision()).
  • Card activation: Used to activate the ISO14443-4 layer on an already singulated card (emvTypeAActivation(), emvTypeBActivation).
  • Card removal: Used to detect phydical removal of the card from the reader field after a payment transaction is completed (emvTypeARemoval(), emvTypeBRemoval()).

The activation and removal operations can also be used via the callbacks provided by EmvPicc_t after anticollision has been completed successfully.

Additionally, this module includes a function to communicate with a type A or type B card with error handling as required by the EMV specifciaton prior to card activation (emvPrelayer4Transceive()).

Function Documentation

s8 emvPrelayer4Transceive ( const u8 *  request,
size_t  requestLength,
u8 *  response,
size_t  maxResponseLength,
size_t *  responseLength,
u32  timeout,
EmvHalTransceiveMode_t  transceiveMode 
)

Send a request to a type A or B card with exception handling according to [CCP v2.01, 9.6 Exception Processing].

Parameters:
requestPointer to the request.
requestLengthLength of the request in bytes.
responsePointer to the array storing the response.
maxResponseLengthMaximum length of the response in bytes.
responseLengthSet to the length of the received response in bytes.
timeoutTimeout in carrier cycles.
transceiveModeEMV IO layer transceive mode to use for the request.
Returns:
EMV_ERR_OK: An error free response has been successfully received.
EMV_ERR_STOPPED: An asynchronous stop request has been received.
EMV_ERR_TIMEOUT: No card response has been received.
EMV_ERR_TRANSMISSION: An errornous card response has been received.
s16 emvTypeAActivation ( EmvPicc_t *  picc)
Note:
This function returns immediately after the ATS has been processed. If an SFGT is requested by the card then it must be taken care of by the caller.
The uid data field of picc is ignored (due to the way ISO14443-A card activation is defined in the standard), all other data fields of picc are set based on the ATS received from the PICC.
Parameters:
[out]piccThe picc to activate.
Returns:
EMV_ERR_OK: The PICC has been successfully activated.
EMV_ERR_STOPPED: An asynchronous stop request has been received.
EMV_ERR_TIMEOUT: A timeout occured during the activation.
EMV_ERR_TRANSMISSION: A transmission error occured during the activation.
EMV_ERR_PROTOCOL: A protocol error occured during the activation.
s16 emvTypeAAnticollision ( EmvPicc_t *  picc)
Note:
This function does NOT include the required wait of T_P milliseconds before the first WUPA command is send (see [CCP v2.01, PCD 9.3.2.1]).
The content of picc maybe altered even if no card is singulated or an error occures.
Parameters:
[out]piccInitialized with the UID of the PICC if a single PICC is found.
Returns:
EMV_ERR_OK: A single card has been found and selected.
EMV_ERR_STOPPED: An asynchronous stop request has been received.
EMV_ERR_TIMEOUT: A timeout occured during the anticollsion.
EMV_ERR_COLLISION: A collison occured during the anticollison.
EMV_ERR_TRANSMISSION: A transmission error occured during the anticollision.
EMV_ERR_PROTOCOL: A protocol error occured during the anticollision.
s16 emvTypeACardPresent ( )
Returns:
0: No type A card(s) detected.
1: Type A card(s) detected.
s16 emvTypeARemove ( EmvPicc_t *  picc)

Performs an ISO14443-A PICC removal in accordance with [CCP v2.01, section 9.5].

Note:
Blocks until the card is physically removed from the field, or a stop request is received (emvStopTerminalApplication()).
Parameters:
[in]piccPICC to be remove from the field.
Returns:
EMV_NO_ERROR: No error, Card removal successful.
EMV_ERR_STOPPED: An asynchronous stop request has been received.
s16 emvTypeBActivation ( EmvPicc_t *  picc)
Note:
This function does return immediately after the ATS has been processed. If an SFGT is requested by the card then this must be taken care of by the caller.
Parameters:
[in]piccThe PICC to activate.
Returns:
EMV_ERR_OK: The PICC has been successfully activated.
EMV_ERR_STOPPED: An asynchronous stop request has been received.
EMV_ERR_TIMEOUT: A timeout occured during the activation.
EMV_ERR_TRANSMISSION: A transmission error occured during the activation.
EMV_ERR_PROTOCOL: A protocol error occured during the activation.
s16 emvTypeBAnticollision ( EmvPicc_t *  picc)
Note:
: This function does NOT include the required wait of T_P milliseconds before the first WUPB command is send (see [CCP, PCD 9.3.2.1]).
The content of picc maybe altered even if no card is singulated or an error occures.
Parameters:
[out]piccThe PUPI and all other data fields are initialized based on the ATTRIB response received if a single card is found.
Returns:
EMV_ERR_OK: A single card has been found and selected.
EMV_ERR_STOPPED: An asynchronous stop request has been received.
EMV_ERR_TIMEOUT: A timeout occured during the anticollsion.
EMV_ERR_COLLISION: A collison occured during the anticollison.
EMV_ERR_PROTOCOL: A protocol error occured during the anticollision.
s16 emvTypeBCardPresent ( )
Returns:
0: No type B card(s) detected.
1: Type B card(s) detected.
s16 emvTypeBRemove ( EmvPicc_t *  picc)

Performs an ISO14443-B PICC removal in accordance with [CCP v2.01, section 9.5].

Note:
Blocks until the card is physically removed from the field, or a stop request is received (emvStopTerminalApplication()).
Parameters:
[in]piccPICC to remove from the field.
Returns:
EMV_NO_ERROR: No error, Card removal successful.
EMV_ERR_STOPPED: An asynchronous stop request has been received.
